title: Do We Really Need to Take 10,000 Steps a Day for Our Health?
description: The advice that we take 10,000 steps a day is more a marketing accident than based on science. Taking far fewer may have notable benefits.
dc:creator: Gretchen Reynolds
media:description: The good news is that upping our current step counts by even a few thousand additional strides most days could be a reasonable, sufficient — and achievable — goal.
